Hi, I'll be your doctor today. What brings you in?

I've noticed this mole on my skin that has some weird changes. The edges are all jagged and messy, not smooth like my other moles. It looks kinda like a shiny pimple that never pops or goes away. There's a bunch of different colors in it—like brown, black, and maybe even some red or blue mixed in. Sometimes it’s super itchy, or feels kind of tingly under my skin. And it keeps changing—getting darker and bigger, or looking different than before. One side of it looks lopsided or uneven.

Thank you for sharing those details. It sounds like this mole has several concerning features, particularly with its irregular edges, changes in color, and size. Can you tell me if the mole has been getting itchy or tingly more frequently? This information can help us understand more about what might be happening.
Yes, it has been really itchy sometimes, and that weird tingly sensation happens too.

I appreciate the clarification on the itchiness and tingling. Can you tell me how long you have noticed this mole and if it has changed over time? Also, have you experienced any pain or bleeding from it?
I've had this mole for a little while now, but it feels like it has changed a lot in the past few weeks. It seems to be getting darker and bigger. I haven't noticed any pain or bleeding, though.

Thank you for that information. The changes you've noticed, especially the mole getting darker and larger, are concerning. I'm curious to know if you have any family history of skin cancer or if you've had significant sun exposure, as these factors can increase the risk.
I'm not really sure about family history of skin cancer, but I know I've spent quite a bit of time in the sun over the years. I try to use sunscreen, but sometimes I forget.

Thank you for sharing that. Your history of sun exposure does add to the concern. Have you noticed any other skin changes or any other moles that have been changing like this one? It’s important to assess if there are multiple areas of concern.
No, I haven't noticed any other moles changing like this one. This is the only one that's been acting so weird.

Thanks for clarifying that this is the only mole that has been changing. Given everything you've shared, the characteristics of this mole are concerning for melanoma. I recommend that you see a dermatologist as soon as possible for a thorough examination. They may suggest a biopsy to determine the nature of the mole more definitively. It's important to address this promptly.
Thank you for your help. I will make an appointment with a dermatologist right away.
